Watch: Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal’s cute Haldi moment melts the internet; fans swoon
description: India batter Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal's wedding festivities have commenced with a vibrant Haldi ceremony. Held two days before their November 23 wedding, the event saw Mandhana, adorned in yellow, celebrating with family, friends, and teammates amidst traditional music and yellow decor. The intimate ceremony offered a colourful glimpse into the couple's wedding week.

title: IPL: 'Destiny has got me to play with him'- Samson opens up on leaving RR for CSK
description: Sanju Samson is thrilled to join Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2026, eager to play alongside his idol MS Dhoni. Traded for Rs 18 Crore, Samson recalled his early admiration for Dhoni and the challenges of meeting him amidst crowds. He expressed immense excitement about sharing the dressing room, breakfast, and practice sessions with the legend.

‘Will benefit all’: SC says accused has right to speedy probe; refrains from setting timeline
description: The Supreme Court affirmed that the right to a speedy investigation is a fundamental right, stating that accused individuals cannot face endless suffering under the threat of ongoing probes. While not setting strict timelines, the court emphasized that inordinate delays can lead to the quashing of cases, benefiting the accused, victim, and society.

Bihar: Nitish Kumar cedes home to BJP's dy CM; JDU takes finance
description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has handed the crucial Home portfolio to Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary of the BJP for the first time in two decades. In return, JDU secured Finance. This move significantly boosts Choudhary's standing within the alliance, with the Home department's control over police and law & order considered politically vital.

Sabrina Carpenter snubs Swift’s Marvel debut to plan wedding with Travis Kelce
description: Pop culture is abuzz as Sabrina Carpenter reportedly meets with Marvel for the Dazzler role, reigniting debate over Taylor Swift's potential casting. Fans long envisioned Swift as the music-powered mutant, citing her stage presence and pop icon status. While Carpenter offers a fresh take, Swift's connection to Dazzler remains a captivating 'what if' for many.

'Communist' meets 'fascist': How Trump-Mamdani first White House meet went - 10 key moments
description: In a surprising White House meeting, Donald Trump and Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani found common ground on New York City's future, despite stark ideological differences. Trump expressed a desire for Mamdani's success, emphasizing the city's importance. Discussions touched on immigration and public safety, with both leaders prioritizing a strong NYC, showcasing a rare moment of bipartisan cooperation.

title: Nepal plans to deploy Army for polls as Oli forms party security unit
Dubai airshow crash: Demo ends in fatal hit; breaks Tejas’ near-flawless run since 2016
description: A Tejas fighter jet crashed during a Dubai Airshow demonstration, tragically killing IAF pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal. The aircraft reportedly failed to recover from a negative G-turn. This marks the second Tejas crash since its induction, raising concerns for India's indigenous fighter project and its export ambitions. An inquiry is underway.

title: Trump says Ukraine's Zelenskyy will have to approve U.S.-backed peace plan
description: Mr. Trump said the approaching winter, the mounting death toll and repeated attacks on Ukrainian energy plants underscored the urgency of ending the war

title: Himani Shivpuri hesitates to address Aishwarya–Salman breakup
description: Veteran actor Himani Shivpuri, who shared screen space with Aishwarya Rai in Hamara Dil Aapke Paas Hai, Inaab, Loot Chale, and Tera Jaadu Chal Gaya, and later acted alongside Abhishek Bachchan in Umrao Jaan, reflected on her experience filming with the former Miss World. When asked about the much-publicised breakup between Aishwarya Rai and Salman Khan supposedly taking place during one of those film shoots, Shivpuri promptly declined to comment.

title: CJI farewell: Gavai says anti-bulldozer ruling his most important; backs SC/ST sub-classification
description: Retiring CJI B.R. Gavai highlighted his judgment against "bulldozer justice" as his most significant, emphasizing its conflict with the rule of law and the right to shelter. He also cited the ruling allowing sub-classification of SCs and STs for reservations as crucial for addressing genuine inequality, quoting Ambedkar on the nuances of equality.

title: Europe has a new fear: China may 'stop its' buses right on roads
description: European nations, particularly Denmark and Norway, are scrutinizing Chinese-made Yutong buses over security fears. Operators worry that 'over-the-air' software updates could allow remote immobilization of the fleet, mirroring concerns over Chinese tech in 5G networks. This potential vulnerability, inherent in connected vehicles, raises geopolitical questions about reliance on foreign manufacturers.

title: 4 Codes replace 29 laws: Labour reforms set for rollout; rules within 45 days

U.N. chief Guterres urges G20 to use power to ease global suffering
description: Mr. Guterres urged G20 members to live up to the commitments made in June in the Financing for Development Conference in Sevilla to unlock more finance for developing countries, triple the lending power of multilateral development banks, and increase their role in leveraging more private finance

title: 'I’ll go when you go … Quiet, piggy': Kimmel hits back after Trump demands his firing
description: President Donald Trump reignited his feud with Jimmy Kimmel after the comedian’s blistering Wednesday monologue about the Epstein files and Trump’s Saudi state dinner. Within 11 minutes of the broadcast ending, Trump demanded ABC “get the bum off the air.” Kimmel hit back on Thursday’s show, mocking the president’s fixation and revisiting their September clash, as Trump simultaneously pressures networks to silence other late-night critics.

title: Afghanistan trade push: Kabul offers tax breaks, 1% duty; seeks deeper ties with India
description: Afghanistan is wooing Indian investors with a five-year tax holiday for new industries and a 1% import duty on raw materials and machinery. Commerce Minister Nooruddin Azizi highlighted priority sectors like cement and textiles, urging Indian companies to invest. He also sought India's help in keeping the Chabahar trade route open amidst logistical challenges.

title: Trump vows ‘we are going to be helping’ New York Mayor-elect Mamdani
description: Washington watchers were bracing for sparks to fly when Mr. Mamdani met Mr. Trump, who has in turn branded the Mayor-elect a “communist” and suggested the Ugandan-born New Yorker should be deported

title: India-Canada thaw: PM Modi to meet Carney at G20; leaders push to rebuild ties
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney will meet at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, aiming to rebuild ties strained by the 2023 killing of a Khalistan separatist.

title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: Putin welcomes US peace plan as 'final settlement'
description: In a diplomatic twist, President Putin of Russia expressed a measured acceptance of a US proposal aimed at peace in Ukraine, indicating it might pave the way for a resolution. However, he criticized Kyiv for what he termed as an unrealistic stance.

description: International students in the US are increasingly drawn to STEM disciplines, with a remarkable 57% opting for studies in science, technology, engineering, and math. This surge is fueled by the rising global need for expertise in fields such as computer science and AI, further supported by initiatives like OPT that grant valuable work opportunities post-graduation.

She filed an FIR against the shop owner, his family, and employees. The shopkeeper has filed a counter-allegation, claiming the woman and a companion stole plates.

UK settlement rules: Indian diaspora slams longer ILR waits; fears rise for care workers
description: New proposals for UK settlement status have drawn widespread criticism from the Indian diaspora. Foreign nationals arriving from 2021 onwards may face a 10-year wait for permanent residency, with care workers facing 15 years. This significantly alters the UK's attractiveness for skilled workers and students.

description: Amazon is cutting approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, with nearly 40% of those in affected states being engineering roles, particularly mid-level software engineers. These layoffs, the largest in the company's history, are attributed by CEO Andy Jassy to a cultural shift towards leaner operations and efficiency gains, not primarily AI or financial reasons.

Workforce reform! 4 labour codes made effective to simplify laws - check details
description: India's government has announced the implementation of four consolidated labor codes, effective November 21, 2025, to modernize regulations and strengthen worker protections. This significant policy shift rationalizes 29 existing laws, aiming to create a future-ready labor ecosystem that promotes formalization, ensures timely wages, and expands social security for all workers.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
description: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit “Tweaker” featuring Drake
description: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.
